title: The national election in 2020 is shaping up to be one of the most critical in US history. What do you consider the most important election ever? - Quora
tags: Political History of the United States of America
History of the United States of America
Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: The Presidential election of 1860. It was one of the most contentious elections in American history, with the continued existence of slavery by far the most important issue. Abraham Lincoln, with his firm resistance to any further expansion of slavery, won because his opponents split 3 ways. Like the Democrats of today refusing to accept the legitimacy of the election of Donald Trump in 2016, the Southern states refused to accept Lincoln’s election and refused to give him a chance to heal the nation. Instead they seceded from the Union starting on December 20, 1860, a little more than 6 weeks after the election, long before March 4, 1861 when Lincoln took the oath of office. The result was the American Civil War.

I’ve been hearing “This next election is going to be the most important / critical yada yada yada” for half a century now. Elections are important, but the hype is getting old. 1860 was big. 1932 was big. I’d go with those.
